qas.question: What Greek word did gymnastics derive from?
What does the  verb gymnazo mean?

answers.text: to train naked", "train in gymnastic exercise", generally "to train, to exercise"
because athletes in ancient times exercised and competed without clothing

qas.question: When did the word come into use?
When did gymnasts start competing with clothing?

plausible_answers.text: to train naked", "train in gymnastic exercise", generally "to train, to exercise".

qas.question: What does the word gymnoto mean?
What language does gymnazein come from?
What word means playing in the gymnasium?

context: The word <b8_0>gymnastics<b8_0/> derives from the common Greek adjective <a0_0>γυμνός (<b6_0>gymnos<b6_0/>) meaning "naked"<a0_0/>, by way of the related verb γυμνάζω (gymnazo), whose meaning is <a1_0><b5_0>to train naked", "train in gymnastic exercise", generally "to train, to exercise"<a1_0/>.<b5_0/> The verb had this meaning, <a2_0>because athletes in ancient times exercised and competed without clothing<a2_0/>. It came into use in <b4_0>the <a3_0>1570s<b4_0/><a3_0/>, from Latin gymnasticus, from <b7_0>Greek<b7_0/> gymnastikos "fond of or skilled in bodily exercise," from gymnazein "to exercise or train" (see gymnasium).
